Fetch tags for accounts and mention data

Source: R/account_tags.R, R/mention_tags.R, R/tags.R
tags.Rd

Fetches tag information, returned as a tibble, for the given account. This can be done for both account information, as well as mentions.

# S3 method for brandseyer2.account
tags(x, ...)

# S3 method for list
tags(x, ...)

# S3 method for data.frame
tags(x, ..., ac = attr(x, "account"), na.rm = TRUE)

tags(x, ...)

Arguments

x

An object to find tag information for, such as an account() or a tibble of mention data.
...

Extra arguments passed to functions.
ac

An optional account object from which to take tag information.
na.rm

Whether to keep mentions that have no tags.

Value

A tibble of tag information. Includes the name, namespace, and description of the tags. Note that topics are stored in the 'topics' namespace.

Methods (by class)

  • brandseyer2.account: Get tags from an account object.

  • list: Create a table of tags for the list of given accounts.

  • data.frame: Fetch tag information from a tibble of mention data.

See also

account() to fetch account data.

topics() to see just a list of topics.

mentions() to query mention data.

Examples


# See what namespaces are in your account
account("TEST01AA") %>%
  tags() %>%
  dplyr::select(namespace) %>%
  table()
#> .
#>        tag      topic topic_tree 
#>          2          3          1 

# Find topics
account("TEST01AA") %>%
  tags() %>%
  dplyr::filter(namespace == "topic")
#> # A tibble: 3 x 7
#>      id name          namespace description       deleted children  is_parent
#>   <dbl> <chr>         <chr>     <chr>             <lgl>   <list>    <lgl>    
#> 1    10 Parent topic  topic     Has children      FALSE   <dbl [2]> TRUE     
#> 2    11 Child topic 1 topic     I am a child      FALSE   <NULL>    FALSE    
#> 3    12 Child topic 2 topic     I am also a child FALSE   <NULL>    FALSE    


# See the tags for multiple accounts at a time.
accounts(c("TEST01AA", "TEST02AA")) %>%
  tags()
#> # A tibble: 11 x 9
#>    account     id name  namespace description deleted children is_parent ac    
#>    <chr>    <dbl> <chr> <chr>     <chr>       <lgl>   <list>   <lgl>     <list>
#>  1 TEST01AA     1 tag1  tag       <NA>        FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  2 TEST01AA     2 tag2  tag       Deleted     TRUE    <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  3 TEST01AA    10 Pare… topic     Has childr… FALSE   <dbl [2… TRUE      <S3: …
#>  4 TEST01AA    11 Chil… topic     I am a chi… FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  5 TEST01AA    12 Chil… topic     I am also … FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  6 TEST01AA  1001 Tree… topic_tr… Topics com… FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  7 TEST02AA   101 tag1  tag       <NA>        FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  8 TEST02AA   102 tag2  tag       Deleted     TRUE    <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#>  9 TEST02AA  1010 Pare… topic     Has childr… FALSE   <dbl [2… TRUE      <S3: …
#> 10 TEST02AA  1011 Chil… topic     I am a chi… FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …
#> 11 TEST02AA  1012 Chil… topic     I am also … FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE     <S3: …

# Finding the tags that mentions matched.
account("TEST01AA") %>%
  mentions("published inthelast week") %>%
  tags()
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   id    tag.id name  namespace description deleted children is_parent
#>   <chr>  <dbl> <chr> <chr>     <chr>       <lgl>   <list>   <lgl>    
#> 1 2-1        1 tag1  tag       <NA>        FALSE   <NULL>   FALSE
